Test: Coverage

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-01-18

Source: vignettes/tests/test_coverage.Rmd
test_coverage.Rmd
library(testthat)
library(ramR)
library(Ryacas)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'Ryacas'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     integrate
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     %*%, diag, diag<-, lower.tri, upper.tri
A <- S <- matrix(
  data = 0,
  nrow = 3,
  ncol = 3
)
A[1, 2] <- 1
A[1, 3] <- 1
diag(S) <- c(0, 0.25, 0.25)
colnames(A) <- rownames(A) <- c("y", "x", "e")
filter <- diag(2)
filter <- cbind(filter, 0)
colnames(filter) <- c("y", "x", "e")
rownames(filter) <- c("y", "x")
u <- as.matrix(c(0.00, 0.50, 0.00))
v <- as.matrix(c(0.50, 0.50, 0.00))
C <- matrix(
  data = c(
    0.50, 0.25, 0.25,
    0.25, 0.25, 0.00,
    0.25, 0.00, 0.25
  ),
  nrow = dim(A)[1]
)
E <- solve(diag(dim(A)[1]) - A)
M <- filter %*% C %*% t(filter)
g <- filter %*% v
results_C_num <- C_num(A, S)
results_E_num <- E_num(A)
results_M_num <- M_num(A, S, filter)
results_S_num <- S_num(A, C)
results_v_num <- v_num(A, u)
results_u_num <- u_num(A, v)
results_g_num <- g_num(A, u, filter)
data <- mvn(n = 1000, A, S, u, filter, empirical = TRUE)
Sigma <- cov(data)
mu <- as.matrix(colMeans(data))
results_C_sym <- as_r(C_sym(A, S))
results_E_sym <- as_r(E_sym(A))
results_M_sym <- as_r(M_sym(A, S, filter))
results_S_sym <- as_r(S_sym(A, C))
results_v_sym <- as_r(v_sym(A, u))
results_u_sym <- as_r(u_sym(A, v))
results_g_sym <- as_r(g_sym(A, u, filter))
test_that("C.", {
  for (i in 1:nrow(C)) {
    for (j in 1:ncol(C)) {
      expect_equal(
        C[i, j],
        results_C_num[i, j],
        results_C_sym[i, j],
        check.attributes = FALSE,
        tolerance = 0.001
      )
    }
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸŒˆ
test_that("E.", {
  for (i in 1:nrow(E)) {
    for (j in 1:ncol(E)) {
      expect_equal(
        E[i, j],
        results_E_num[i, j],
        results_E_sym[i, j],
        check.attributes = FALSE,
        tolerance = 0.001
      )
    }
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥³
test_that("M.", {
  for (i in 1:nrow(M)) {
    for (j in 1:ncol(M)) {
      expect_equal(
        M[i, j],
        Sigma[i, j],
        results_M_num[i, j],
        results_M_sym[i, j],
        check.attributes = FALSE,
        tolerance = 0.001
      )
    }
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽ‰
test_that("S.", {
  for (i in 1:nrow(S)) {
    for (j in 1:ncol(S)) {
      expect_equal(
        S[i, j],
        results_S_num[i, j],
        results_S_sym[i, j],
        check.attributes = FALSE,
        tolerance = 0.001
      )
    }
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸŒˆ
test_that("v.", {
  for (i in 1:nrow(v)) {
    for (j in 1:ncol(v)) {
      expect_equal(
        v[i, j],
        results_v_num[i, j],
        results_v_sym[i, j],
        check.attributes = FALSE,
        tolerance = 0.001
      )
    }
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽ‰
test_that("u.", {
  for (i in 1:nrow(u)) {
    for (j in 1:ncol(u)) {
      expect_equal(
        u[i, j],
        results_u_num[i, j],
        results_u_sym[i, j],
        check.attributes = FALSE,
        tolerance = 0.001
      )
    }
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜¸
test_that("g.", {
  for (i in 1:nrow(g)) {
    for (j in 1:ncol(g)) {
      expect_equal(
        g[i, j],
        mu[i, j],
        results_g_num[i, j],
        results_g_sym[i, j],
        check.attributes = FALSE,
        tolerance = 0.001
      )
    }
  }
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽŠ
A <- S <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 2
)
test_that("E_num: square.", {
  expect_error(
    E_num(A)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥‡
test_that("E_sym: square.", {
  expect_error(
    E_sym(A)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜¸
test_that("C_num: S is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    C_num(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥³
test_that("C_sym: S is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    C_sym(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜¸
test_that("S_num: A is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    S_num(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥³
test_that("S_sym: A is a square matrix.", {
  expect_error(
    S_sym(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŽ‰
S <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 3
)
test_that("C_num: A and S have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    C_num(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥‡
test_that("C_sym: A and S have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    C_sym(A, S)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ¥³
A <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 3
)
C <- matrix(
  0,
  ncol = 3,
  nrow = 2
)
test_that("S_num: A and C have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    S_num(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŒˆ
test_that("S_sym: A and C have the same dimensions.", {
  expect_error(
    S_sym(A, C)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜€
A <- matrix(
  data = c(0, -1, -1, 0),
  nrow = 2,
  ncol = 2
)
test_that("E_num: singular.", {
  expect_error(
    E_num(A)
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸŒˆ
